thread.title: Lovely gesture from Russian supermodel who offers Manchester United fans blankets
thread.title_full: Lovely gesture from Russian supermodel who offers Manchester United fans blankets

author: Alex Smith
title: Lovely gesture from Russian supermodel who offers Manchester United fans blankets
text:
Lovely gesture from Russian supermodel who offers Manchester United fans blankets Temperatures were close to freezing for United's draw with FC Rostov on Thursday night Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Lovely gesture from Russian Supermodel who offers Manchester United fans blankets Share this video Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United fans have fallen in love with supermodel Victoria Lopyreva - after she handed out blankets head of their clash with FC Rostov . 
United fans were subjected to temperatures closing in on zero degrees centigrade in the Russian city around 130 miles from Moscow in their Europa League clash on Thursday night. 
Despite it being only a couple of degrees colder in Rostov than it was in the UK, Lopyreva went on the charm offensive by attempting to keep the visiting supporters warm. Lopyreva will certainly catch the eye of footie fans heading to Russia next summer (Photo: Victoria Lopyreva / Instagram) Read More Supermodel Victoria Lopyreva leads campaign to erase growing fears of trouble at the World Cup in Russia Lopyreva likes to share the love (Photo: Victoria Lopyreva / Instagram) Lopyreva is a big football fan and cannot wait for the Finals to get underway (Photo: Victoria Lopyreva / Instagram) 
The team on the pitch were less hospitable as Aleksandr Bukharov cancelled out Henrikh Mkhitaryan's first half to make it all to play for in the second leg next week. 
Loverly Lopyreva, who is an ambassador for next year's World Cup in the country, had been doing all she could to ease growing fears of violence at the show case tournament. 
“This is a historic moment for Russia and for Rostov, my home city,” said Lopyreva, as she gave media from Russia and England a guided tour of the new 45,000-seater stadium under construction in Rostov and the city itself, sharing her favourite restaurants and places to visit. 
“Everyone in Rostov is so excited be to hosting World Cup games and to have so many great teams and nations coming here. I believe that it will be fantastic and I believe we will be fully ready to host the World Cup. Mkhitaryan gave United an away goal (Photo: John Peters) Read More Manchester United stars arrive back in the UK with three days to prepare for crucial FA Cup clash with Chelsea But Bukharov cancelled it out (Photo: REUTERS) 
“We have had very good experience of hosting the Olympic games and I believe that here in Rostov we are going to be absolutely ready, in terms of the security as well. 
“Everybody wants to be involved. Everybody wants to be a volunteer at the World Cup and to play their part. We want people to know that Russia is something bigger than just Moscow and St Petersburg. 
“That's why there are 11 cities hosting games at the World Cup, including Rostov, my home city. Believe me, everybody here is so happy to host such a mega event and there is real excitement here. 
“We want people to see the friendly, smiley face of Russia, which is really important for us." poll loading Will Manchester United beat FC Rostov? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
